meanings.definition: The state or fact of being organized in a tribe or tribes.
meanings.sent1: In some parts of the world, tribalism is still a common way of life.
meanings.sent2: The history class discussed the impact of tribalism on ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, the tribalism in seating arrangements led to some confusion.
meanings.sent4: The tribalism of the animal kingdom can be seen in the behavior of wolf packs.
meanings.sent5: The tribalism of the community was evident during the annual festival.

meanings.definition: Strong loyalty to one's own tribe, party, or group.
meanings.sent1: Her tribalism towards her favorite sports team was unwavering.
meanings.sent2: Political tribalism often leads to division and conflict.
meanings.sent3: The tribalism among fans of different music genres can be amusing to observe.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, the tribalism of neighbors coming together is heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The tribalism of students supporting their school at the championship game was inspiring.
